text: Eric John Bristow MBE ("The Crafty Cockney") (25 April 1957 â€“ 5 April 2018) was a professional English darts player. He was ranked number one by the World Darts Federation a record six times, in 1980 and 81, 1983 to 1985, and in 1990. He was a five-time World Champion, a five-time World Masters Champion and a four-time World Cup singles champion. Bristow died on 5 April 2018 after a heart attack in Liverpool at the age of 60. ==References== ==Other websites== *Eric Bristow's profile and stats on Darts Database *Arrows - A John Samson documentary about Eric Bristow (1979) *Eric Bristow at the British Film Institute Category:1957 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Darts players Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:People from Hackney Category:Sportspeople from London
title: Eric Bristow
